The general outline is as follows:
That place is adorned with the seven treasures.
There are no hells, hungry ghosts, birds, beasts, or even insects or worms.
It is always pure and natural.
There is no impurity or mixture of any kind.
Therefore, it is called the Pure Land.
All of them are born in lotus flowers.
They live long lives without aging.
Clothing, food, and dwellings are transformed according to their wishes.
The seasons are always spring.
There is no more cold or heat.
They experience great happiness.
There is no suffering or distress of any kind.
Therefore, it is called the Land of Ultimate Bliss.

Even for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, they are inexhaustible.

Excellent!

Even if you do this for many eons,
It is a hundred thousand times more.
It cannot be compared.

When Shakyamuni Buddha first wanted to speak of Amitabha Buddha,

The Essentials of the Pure Land, the Five Pure Land Biographies say:
Amitabha Buddha, together with the two Bodhisattvas Avalokitesvara and Mahasthamaprapta,

If one is willing to go, there is no one who cannot be reborn there.
Contemplating this, it is because the Bodhisattvas have compassion for sentient beings who are drowning in the sea of suffering and cannot escape.
They use the power of their vows to attract people to be reborn in the Pure Land.
It is like boatmen attracting travelers to board their boats and sending them to the other shore.
People are only afraid of not believing.

The Essentials of the Pure Land The Essentials of the Pure Land The Buddha Amitabha made a vow, saying:
Those who are already born in my land and wish to be born in other lands,
according to their wishes, will never again fall into the three evil paths.
Why is this? Those born in the Pure Land will definitely attain the forbearance of the non-arising of dharmas.
Moreover, the forbearance of the non-arising of dharmas,
is the understanding of birth and death.
Although one enters the realm of birth and death,
this one nature is already not obscured.
Since the one nature is not obscured,
how can one do evil?
In terms of principle, there is certainly no falling back.
Moreover, relying on the Buddha's power, falling back is definitely impossible.
Therefore, those who are born in the Pure Land not only live long and do not age,
but also have mastery over birth and death.
They wish to manifest and transform all sentient beings, entering the realm of birth and death of all sentient beings,
while their true nature is always serene and bright.
They are no longer deluded by external things,
and are no longer pulled by karmic conditions.
Although they are in the world of samsara,
they are no longer subject to rebirth.
This is called transcending the world.
It means that although they are in the world, they have transcended the world.
Therefore, those who are born in the Pure Land and have mastery over birth and death,
if they wish to be born in the heavens, they can;
if they wish to be born in the human realm, they can;
if they wish to be born in a place of great wealth and nobility, they can;
if they wish to be born in a pure place, they can;
if they wish to live long and not die, they can;
if they wish to die and be reborn again, they can.
Whatever they desire, they have complete mastery over.
This is why cultivating the Pure Land is so valuable.
Worldly people do not understand this principle.
In vain they suffer in birth and death.
Desiring to be born in a wealthy and noble family, they are born instead in poverty and lowliness.
Desiring to be born in a place of happiness, they are born instead in sorrow and distress.
Desiring to be born with a long life, they are born instead with an early death.
Desiring to be born in a good realm, they are born instead in an evil realm.
In various ways, they are deluded by external objects.
They are dragged along by the causes and conditions of karma.
They do not have freedom.
Therefore, since beginningless kalpas, they have been cycling through the six realms and cannot escape.
One should think of these worries and sufferings and turn one's mind to the Pure Land.
